article.headline: Arizona State 69, Cal State-San Bernadino 52
article.story: TEMPE, Ariz. (AP) -- Antwi Atuahene scored 11 points and had five assists to lead five players in double figures as Arizona State beat Cal-State San Bernardino 69-52 Wednesday night to give new coach Herb Sendek his first victory. Steve Jones added 12 points while Jerren Shipp had 11 points, five rebounds and four assists for the Sun Devils (1-1). Lance Ortiz led San Bernardino (0-1) with 11 points and four assists. Arizona State, ahead 37-21 at halftime, scored the first 10 points of the second half and led by as many as 35. The Sun Devils, who made just 10 of 36 from beyond the 3-point line in Monday night's 75-71 loss to Northern Arizona, was 10 of 20 on Wednesday night. Atuahene scored five points during a 12-0 run late in the first half that helped his team take control. Jeff Pendergraph had eight points and eight rebounds in the first half. Jones scored all his points in the second half, hitting a trio of 3-pointers in a 99-second span that gave Arizona State a 56-26 lead with 12:36 to play.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
